items.sentence: Tomorrow\'s French class has been canceled.
Have you ever been to Boston in the spring?
Have you gotten used to living in the dorm?
Have you received an answer to your letter?
Have you shown Tom the new book you bought?
Even Tom doesn\'t think he\'ll get the job.
Even Tom\'s enemies admit he\'s a just man.
Don\'t play with that gun. It\'s not a toy.
I didn\'t know that Tom was Mary\'s cousin.
I didn\'t know that Tom was Mary\'s father.
I didn\'t know that Tom was Mary\'s nephew.
I didn\'t know that you weren\'t Canadians.
You don\'t get eggplants from a gourd vine.
I thought Tom wasn\'t allowed to eat candy.
I thought Tom would be at today\'s meeting.
Tom tried to persuade Mary to quit smoking.
Tom asked everyone to take their shoes off.
It looks like Tom has lost a little weight.
Poker is one of Tom\'s favorite card games.
Tom was afraid of hurting Mary\'s feelings.
Tom arrived just as we were about to leave.
Tom and Mary take turns washing the dishes.
We spent hours trying to solve the problem.
We took shelter from the rain under a tree.
We were very tired from the five-hour trip.
I want Tom to tell Mary about the accident.
I want everyone to help me clean the house.
Tom knew something bad was about to happen.
Tom knew that Mary was unlikely to do that.
I have to find out when Tom plans to leave.
I never wanted to talk about what happened.
Tom lives above me and Mary lives below me.
Tom lives in a penthouse on the 30th floor.
Tom lives in the same neighborhood as Mary.
Tom lives just a few blocks away from here.
Tom doesn\'t yet know Mary didn\'t do that.
Tom will no doubt get better at doing that.
Tom is unlikely to go with us next weekend.
Tom is used to sitting all day at his desk.
Tom is usually useless in these situations.
Tom is very different from what I expected.
Tom is very interested in American history.
Tom is waiting for Mary in the parking lot.
Didn\'t you see anyone there that you knew?
Why didn\'t you tell me you couldn\'t swim?
There\'s a convertible parked in the drive.
There\'s a lot I want to talk to you about.
There\'s a nice park in the center of town.
Have you made up your mind to come with me?
Can you please explain that in more detail?
I hear you\'re interested in making a deal.
Tom doesn\'t plan on doing that by himself.
Tom doesn\'t plan to stay here much longer.
Tom doesn\'t play the banjo, but Mary does.
Tom doesn\'t really expect to win, does he?
Tom doesn\'t really have any close friends.
Tom doesn\'t really know where he was born.
Ask Tom and he\'ll tell you the same thing.
Don\'t forget to wish Tom a happy birthday.
A true gentleman never betrays his friends.
You\'ll get there in less than ten minutes.
Tom and Mary are getting married in Boston.
Tom and Mary are having a really good time.
Tom and Mary are in the car waiting for us.
Tom and Mary are in the same class as John.
What language do you usually speak at home?
What language do you usually speak at work?
What time did you get out of bed yesterday?
What vegetables do you have in your garden?
Tom walked out of the store without paying.
Tom wanted to prove to Mary he could do it.
I couldn\'t think of the name of the place.
I didn\'t call Tom like I promised I would.

If you want to try it, go ahead and try it.

You\'ve sharpened the knives, haven\'t you?

Tom doesn\'t have to get up early tomorrow.

Tom speaks French much better than English.
